item.title: David add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Get busy living or get busy dying." -- Stephen King

item.title: David add a quote by Robert Bloch
item.description: "Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk." -- Robert Bloch

item.title: David add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Go then, there are other worlds than these." -- Stephen King

item.title: David add a quote by Tom Clancy
item.description: "The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense." -- Tom Clancy

item.title: David add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: David add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: David add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: David add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: David add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: David add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "To say "I love you" one must know first how to say the "I"." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: David add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The man who damns money has obtained it dishonorably; the man who respects it has earned it." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: David add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: David add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "There are no contradictions. If you find one, check your premises." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: David add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description:
"The word "We" is as lime poured over men, which sets and hardens to stone, and crushes all beneath it, and that which is white and that which is black are lost equally in the grey of it. It is the word by which the depraved steal the virtue of the good, by which the weak steal the might of the strong, by which the fools steal the wisdom of the sages.
What is my joy if all hands, even the unclean, can reach into it? What is my wisdom, if even the fools can dictate to me? What is my freedom, if all creatures, even the botched and impotent, are my masters? What is my life, if I am but to bow, to agree and to obey?
But I am done with this creed of corruption.
I am done with the monster of "We," the word of serfdom, of plunder, of misery, falsehood and shame.
And now I see the face of god, and I raise this god over the earth, this god whom men have sought since men came into being, this god who will grant them joy and peace and pride.
This god, this one word:
"I." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: David add a quote by Ayn Rand
